attributes.action: Ensure all the online sellers clearly display/promote Made in Britain products
attributes.background: I would like the Government to support British manufacturers in order to create skilled jobs and encourage creativity and sustainable growth.
attributes.additional_details: I want the Government to make it compulsory to all the online sellers such as Amazon, eBay, Argos, Curry's, Supermarkets, etc. to clearly display (by having a Union Flag symbol) whether the product they are selling is made in Britain or any other countries. This will allow public to buy a British made product over the non-British products. It will decrease Britain's dependency on other countries for imports as well as improve Britain's productivity and competitiveness.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324122

attributes.action: Replace GDP with a measure that includes human health, happiness and wellbeing
attributes.background: The government should consult on alternative measures of national welfare taking into account non-economic factors including human health and happiness, as well as the health of the environment. A firm commitment should be made to replacing GDP as the sole or main measure of national prosperity.
attributes.additional_details:
Increasing GDP has been the holy grail of governments for centuries but an ever-expanding economy is incompatible with the challenges we face in the 21st century. Policies aimed at increasing GDP have given us the climate emergency, plastic pollution and mass extinctions. We've suffered recessions which have cost livelihoods and lives and seen whole regions passed by in the spoils of growth.

We need a new yardstick to aim for which leads to a more sustainable and happy future for us all.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do, in particular we don't know what you mean by replacing GDP. There is not a single, official measure that the Government use to assess policy impact or the health of the country.

The Office for National Statistics already collects data on a range of areas, you can find more information here: https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/wellbeing
                
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, such as changes to specific policies. For example, you could start a petition requesting a specific strategy for increasing human health, happiness and wellbeing.

attributes.action: Increase salaries of healthcare workers by 25% from 2020/21 because of covid19
attributes.background:
The covid19 emergency has seen healthcare staff step up with courage and true dedication. They are keeping the nation alive and well, despite putting their own lives and that of their families, at increased risk. 
The pay freeze does 10 years is disgraceful and now needs to be urgently redressed.
attributes.additional_details:
To value and reward courageous healthcare staff who are saving the nation. 
It will also help increase the workforce, without which the health of the nation cannot be sustained. 
The pay freeze and pension debacle, has led to many losing many thousands of pounds and some living close to the poverty line.
This is a national disgrace when one considers the selflessness and calling that those in the NHS show. Clinical staff must get priority in this.

attributes.action: Mandatory sustainability/climate-based lessons in primary and secondary schools.
attributes.background: To make sustainability/climate-based classes compulsory in all UK primary and secondary school curriculums to ensure that the next generation not only is informed about sustainable decisions but also take an interest in the importance of sustainability and issues surrounding the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Many children take no active interest in the environment and have little knowledge on how to live a sustainable lifestyle, often because they have had no exposure to the natural world or know the impact of human behaviour on the environment.
It is essential to educate future generations within the UK to ensure that government environmental targets are met and that individuals even in landlocked cities are given the chance to experience natural environments while learning about there importance.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300279

attributes.action: Generic packaging on FMCG and change labels on non-sustainable packaging
attributes.background: Implement the recommendations of the EFRA committee’s report ‘The price of plastic: ending the toll of plastic waste’ - but go further faster. Introduce generic packaging for fast moving consumer goods (FMCG) for reuse by 2025.
attributes.additional_details: My mother spends her weekends rescuing penguins & turtles in SA - most have been maimed by plastic. 100m marine animals die a year. Gov figures estimate the UK generated 2.5m tonnes of packaging waste in 2021. There are people trying to be environmentally responsible but its difficult & time consuming. UK Gov & UKPP  targets for 2042 aren’t ambitious enough - by then we’d we have created 50m tonnes of plastic waste & killed 2e9 animals? Quantities are standard - why isn’t packaging?

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We understand you'd like plain packaging for FMCG but it's not clear from your petition what labelling changes you'd like to see. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: A sustainable solution for the UK's neurodiversity diagnosis & support crisis.
attributes.background:
Address the UK's ND (Neurodiversity) crisis.
Increase current mental health funding to include ND related services.
Introduce private company Incentives to address ND related issues through services like private diagnosis & occupational therapy to lessen the financial burden on the government.
attributes.additional_details:
Poor mental health figures are a fraction of the estimated undiagnosed adult ND population. There is an overlap and a potential opportunity to incorporate ND funding into current mental health support.

Insufficient education means children are suffering through inherent stigma and resistance of child labelling from concerned parents.

The current diagnosis/support system is unfit for purpose. Wait times are exponentially growing through increased demand.

This is a spiralling national crisis.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about neurodiversity going undiagnosed, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Your petition refers to incentives for private companies, but it's not clear what incentives you want the Government to introduce for private companies.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Improve awareness of mental health conditions and support for sufferers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616860

Make the teaching of neurodiversity mandatory in schools: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621382

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, we could accept a petition calling on the Government to provide additional funding to support diagnosis and support for neurodiverse individuals.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for motorcycle riders to have to wear Full Protective Gear.

A law should be passed which ensures riders should NOT be able to pass their CBT (Compulsory Basic Training) without it.
If they are caught riding a motorcycle in shorts & T-shirt, they should be pulled over and given points on their licence or a fine.
attributes.additional_details:
I have worked in the Emergency Department as a Nurse and have seen the most horrific injuries sustained by motorcycle riders who have come off their bikes without wearing the appropriate safety gear.
Fact: A rider will lose 1mm of their exposed flesh for every mph they are travelling over 30mph.
Most culprits are younger riders on mopeds which can travel in excess of 40mph - that is 10mm of their exposed skin lost.
PLEASE put this petition through and get this law passed.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/622385

attributes.action: Call for a vote of confidence on the leadership of Liz Truss.
attributes.background: Lizz Truss is incompetent and a vote of confidence must be heard. She is crashing an already fragile economy without scrutiny and is causing economic self-harm. Those with mortgages could face double-digit rates becasue of her policies. This is not sustainable, she cannot be allowed to continue.
attributes.additional_details: The pound has plummeted, inflation will rise further, people will have their homes repossessed. This is utter incompetence on a massive scale. What more do you need to call for a vote of confidence?

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could start a petition about that.

attributes.action: Government to limit wholesale gas and oil prices to a sustainable level
attributes.background:
The UK government to take action to link with other governments around the world to achieve this. 
Only by directly limiting gas and oil price increases will the current inflation levels and energy affordability be prevented from destroying the world’s economies
attributes.additional_details: Use current governmental linkages around the world to build a consensus to put pressure on producers who are profiteering from the situation we are in.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Wholesale gas prices are a matter for producers, rather than the Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Stop forcing taxpayers to subsidise the meat, dairy and egg industries
attributes.background: Allow the individual taxpayer the option to opt out of supporting outdated, unnecessary, cruel and environmentally damaging industries like meat, dairy and eggs, and to instead support/subsidise sustainable plant based alternatives
attributes.additional_details: It was precedented in early 2020 that ethical veganism is now a protected characteristic under the Equality Act 2010, but this is entirely at odds with the fact that the UK government forces us to support and subsidise the slowly failing meat, dairy and egg industries with our taxes. In the interest of the environment, the animals, and the future of the planet I propose these subsidies be redirected towards plant based alternatives, or at the very least give the taxpayer the option to do this

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about support for animal agriculture, we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. It's not clear if you want the Government to change financial support arrangements for agriculture, or how money to fund this is raised.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Endorse and implement the Plant Based Treaty: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/618747

attributes.action: Stricter restrictions on businesses to reduce their greenhouse gas emissions
attributes.background: We're asking for the government to place restrictions on the most polluting UK companies to set a cap on the level of GHG emissions they can emit, depending on factors such as the size and nature of the company. If they exceed their cap, they should face some form of sanction, such as a fine.
attributes.additional_details: A study has shown that 100 companies are responsible for 71% of global greenhouse gas emissions. This means that in order to tackle climate change and save our planet, action must be taken to stop these polluting companies from further damaging the world. I believe these restrictions would be one of the most effective ways to ensure large companies finally move towards more sustainable ways of running their business, before it's too late.

rejection.details:
We understand you would like a cap on greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions to be created and for businesses to be fined if they exceed that cap. However, the UK already operates the UK Emissions Trading Scheme, which sets a maximum amount of GHG emissions businesses can emit. Businesses in sectors to which this scheme applies have to report their emissions, and there is a cost implication if they exceed the cap. You can read more about this scheme here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/participating-in-the-uk-ets/participating-in-the-uk-ets.

It's therefore not clear how the emissions cap you are proposing would differ from the existing ETS, nor to which businesses you want this new scheme to apply.

You could have a petition calling for certain changes to be made to the ETS, or for it to be replaced with a different system, so long as it was clear what those changes were or how that new system would operate.

attributes.action: Stricter laws placed on businesses to reduce their greenhouse gas emissions
attributes.background: Impose stricter laws on polluting businesses to reduce their emissions by a certain amount each year, depending on various factors such as the size and nature of each company.
attributes.additional_details: A study has shown that 100 companies are responsible for 71% of global greenhouse gas emissions. This means that in order to tackle climate change and save our planet, action must be taken to stop these polluting companies from further damaging the world. I believe stricter laws would be one of the most effective ways to ensure large companies finally move towards more sustainable ways of running their business, before it's too late.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about commercial emissions, but it's not clear what new laws you want the Government to introduce.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Make energy use more sustainable.
attributes.background: Energy companies have to be banned if they do not use sustainable energy. Companies should be more sustainable. Please sign this petition to help the world be more green, allowing people to be more healthy and happy.
attributes.additional_details: Most companies around the UK are in the position to do so. Companies just want money and do not care about the world, but the reason companies are there are to make the world easier. They are not.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about energy sustainability, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

Many energy companies are not responsible for energy generation, and even customers on green tariffs will receive electricity that is not generated by renewables. It's therefore not clear which energy companies you want to be banned, or if what you actually want is for all non-renewable energy generation in the UK to be banned.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Review employment conditions in the gym and leisure industry.
attributes.background: Implement stricter rules for employers within the gym and leisure industry to provide staff more stability and rights. Company’s within the fitness industry currently put in place work models that make it extremely difficult for employees to make a sustainable income.
attributes.additional_details: An example of how companies can take advantage of employees, is by virtually splitting the job into two roles, one self employed role and one employee role. Then charge more in fees for the self employed role than they payout for the employee role. At the gym I am employed at they charge £200 more in rent than what they pay, meaning employees never keep the pay they earned from work done. This makes it difficult for individuals to sustain their employee role and their self employed business.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

The Government is responsible for setting employment law, but how businesses choose to structure their working arrangements are a matter for individual businesses, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.additional_details: Russia/Putin need to understand that what they are doing is not acceptable.  A military response may not be possible, but boycotting trade/goods will cause Russia to look at the sustainability of their actions, and face up to world opinion, or even force the people to remove Government.  No debating which sporting/music events go ahead, block everything until war stops or Putin removed.  This could give the UK people a way of helping Ukraine.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Place the strictest possible sanctions on Russia until it withdraws from Ukraine: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609428

Seize assets held by anyone with close ties to the Russian government: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609418

Full embargo of Russian imports in lieu of active military support in Ukraine: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609457

attributes.action: Change footpaths, bridleways and cycle routes to open access public paths.
attributes.background: Public paths would be accessible to people on foot, with a horse or bicycle. Since 2000, horse ownership and the uptake of cycling have increased dramatically, which has not been matched by infrastructural developments. Increasing off-road access would minimize risk to vulnerable road users.
attributes.additional_details:
Firstly, we would like the government to derestrict access through the implementation of public paths to reduce road incidents involving horses and cyclists.

Secondly, increased off-road access could encourage people to cycle, which may help with the government's fight against the obesity epidemic.

Thirdly, implementing public paths would aid the government's goal of promoting lower carbon transport by increasing the usage of sustainable transport, such as cycling, for commuting and leisure.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see changes to public rights of way, but it's not clear exactly what changes you want to be made to existing routes. For example, many cycle routes are part of the road system, and it's not clear if you want these to be made shared spaces for pedestrians, cyclists and horse riders.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Remove green levy’s from household bills and rely on private investment.
attributes.background:
Remove green levy’s from household bills, there is enough market interest in sustainability, and the environment to maximise the opportunity through the private sector.
Allow the private sector to fund and drive forward net zero and increase renewable energy sources
attributes.additional_details: To release the tax/bill payer from the the cost of investing without a return, others are profit making on the tax/bill payers mandatory payments.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607977

attributes.action: Make rail season tickets a salary sacrificable cost to level up against cars
attributes.background: Similar to the car salary sacrifice scheme, make annual and flexi rail season and tickets eligible for the salary sacrifice scheme. Employers would encourage people to commute using public transport.
attributes.additional_details: With the UK sustainability strategy, a scheme that promotes car ownership with no equivalent for public transport is illogical. Enabling people to use salary sacrifice will reduce the cost of rail for commuting, encourage people to commute back to the office. This would fit with the government climate ambitions and aligns with Great British Railways ambitions.

rejection.details: Employers can already offer salary sacrifice arrangements for public transport. You can find out more about this here: https://www.gov.uk/expenses-and-benefits-public-transport/what-to-report-and-pay

attributes.action: Outdated 1960s tree felling laws must change to stop wildlife population decline
attributes.background:
Forest tree felling licences can't include 'enforceable conditions' to safeguard rare wildlife: https://theconversation.com/rare-woodland-wildlife-at-risk-because-of-50-year-old-tree-felling-rules-107535

Scotland has new law. Wales is bringing in new law. England must follow to halt wildlife loss
attributes.additional_details:
It's illegal to kill red squirrels. Yet English forests containing them aren't protected and can be cut down

The UK Forest Standard approach to sustainable forestry doesn't prevent this e.g. Welsh Government recognised 'a disjoint' between the Forestry Act and other environmental legislation, leading to gaps in wildlife protection:

https://www.thenational.wales/environment/19771766.planned-change-welsh-forestry-law-protect-red-squirrels/

Guidelines in England are no replacement for law change

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about existing rules relating to licenses granted under the Forestry Act, but we're not sure exactly what changes you'd like to be made to the legislation governing these licences.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Ban Single-Use Plastic, Food and Drink Packaging.
attributes.background: We'd like parliament to ban single-use fruit and vegetable packaging and single-use coffee cups, in the same way that France has announced plans to do the same in 2022. We want the UK government to lead the world into a greener more sustainable way of living.
attributes.additional_details: 10's of Billions of single-use items are discarded in the UK every year, you only need to visit one of our once pristine beaches to see how it affects the environment, killing 100's of thousands of marine animals and birds each year. In addition as all plastic is made from oil, the plastics industry is a huge net contributor to global warming. Plastic straws and cutlery have been banned, now is the time to make a REAL difference by banning single-use plastic food and drink containers.

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594901
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/595495

attributes.action: Close golf courses and re-use the land to rebuild England forests.
attributes.background:
British golf courses are calculated to cover 1,256sq km, that is roughly the equivalent to the whole of Greater Manchester. 

Close the golf courses and rebuild UK woodlands to help fight climate change, create new sustainable jobs for young & old. Support & create communities that strive.
attributes.additional_details: One mature tree can provide enough oxygen per day to support between 2 to 10 people. It is a realistic simple solution that is necessary to help fight climate change and have an immediate affect on its citizens. It is predicted that we will experience more floods and this is a sustainable method to protect the UK from such disasters. It will create new eco systems, purify the air and support science/health research. To fight erosion from the rain, increase pollination & wild life. Use our lands.

rejection.details:
The use of privately-owned golf courses for reforestation is a matter for their owners, not the UK Government or Parliament.

If there is an action you'd like to see taken, for which the UK Government or Parliament is directly responsible, you could start a petition about that.

attributes.action: Create a 'National Health and Fitness Sustainability Day'
attributes.background: Create a 'National Health and Fitness Sustainability Day' to highlight the movement towards a more sustainable way of living in the UK, to allow for the creation of a healthier world and brighter future!
attributes.additional_details: The climate crisis is hot in discussion at the moment, it is crucial to make light of this topic in everyday life, taking the steps necessary to limit damage to the planet. This will allow us to become a innovative leader within the environmental movement, inspiring others to follow suit.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for designating specific days.

We could accept a petition calling for the Government to fund a campaign on National Health and Fitness Sustainability. but you'd need to be clear what that involved.

attributes.action: Rename agricultural subsidy to Farming Benefit and absorb into Universal Credit
attributes.background: Subsidies to farmers are just another form of means-tested income support. As such they should be renamed as Farming Benefit and brought under the umbrella of Universal Credit.
attributes.additional_details: The introduction of Farming Benefit and its eventual absorption into Universal Credit will remove any uncertainty farmers and their families have regarding continued sustainability of the farming industry following the loss of any EU subsidies they may have received in the past, and will help them as they work, grow and adapt to any post-Brexit changes in their role and requirements within the UK farming industry.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see changes to how agricultural subsidies are provided, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

There are a number of different grants available to the agricultural sector, and none of them are called "agricultural subsidy". We could accept a petition calling for changes to how new agricultural grants work, but it would need to be clear what changes you wanted to be made to these.

attributes.action: Introduce legislation that stipulates all consumer good packaging is recyclable.
attributes.background:
Introduce legislation that stipulates that all consumer goods packaging is either compostable or recyclable by 2030 or sooner.

The government should commit to its ‘Green Industrial Revolution’ and introduce legislation that requires manufacturers to package goods in a sustainable way.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK currently produces around 26m tonnes of waste each year and only around c.45% of this is recycled each year with other comparable European countries such as Germany and Austria recycling c.60%.

Current packaging materials and technology available can meet all the criteria for sustainable packaging. This will position UK well in working towards closed loop product cycles and a circular economy.

rejection.details:
We think that the ask of your petition is covered by a petition we currently have open. You may like to sign the below petition:

Ban packaging that is not biodegradable or domestically recyclable
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574939

attributes.action: Introduce a mandatory requirement for Key-Workers to be paid for break times.
attributes.background: Introduce a mandatory requirement for businesses and organisations who were classed as Key-Workers and are on hourly wages, to be paid for break times taken for employees on a full-time contract (35 Hours+ a week).
attributes.additional_details: Over the pandemic, Keyworkers were the ones at risk feeding and caring for the nation. For example, Supermarkets don't pay for the break times their staff, it is not a legal requirement unless stated in their employee contract. Supermarkets have proven to be one of the most profitable and sustainable businesses during these times, yet they do not pay for breaks even though most have had record profits this year. It's time we start paying there accordingly.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about whether to pay key workers for their breaks are a matter for individual employers, not the Government or House of Commons.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

We could accept a petition calling for changes to employment law requiring employers to pay their staff for breaks, if that's something you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Our National Flagship Should be a Tall Ship
attributes.background: In place of the £250m UK flagship, our government should invest £80m in building an 80 metre Sail Training tall ship named Prince Phillip, a ship that would deliver environmental education across the nation while developing the key competencies young people need to excel in any British industry.
attributes.additional_details:
A further £100m could build a spectacular 100 metre tall ship for developing our future naval officers and representing our nation abroad, hosting events wherever the Prime Minister may go.

The remaining £70m could recommission STS Lord Nelson, restore Falls of Clyde and sustain the community programmes delivered by all four vessels for decades to come.

That's four wind powered flagships for Britain with a century of valuable service ahead of them: a truly priceless investment in our nation.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

STS Lord Nelson and the ship Falls of Clyde are not owned by the UK Government, so restoring them would be a matter for their owners, and we cannot accept petitions calling for the UK Government to purchase specific privately owned objects.

We could accept a petition calling for the proposed spending to be redirected to other projects, but we also couldn't accept a petition calling for any of the ships to be named after a particular individual.

attributes.action: Implement Climate Crisis and Sustainability into the National Curriculum
attributes.background: Majority of students in the UK are unaware of the severity of the climate crisis, and the inevitable impact it will have on their future lives. This is due to its minimal coverage of the topic within the school curriculum.
attributes.additional_details: This new policy would aim to solve this issue by increasing awareness to children from a young age. Furthermore, it aims to spark conversations and critical thought in young people, which could lead to proactive change and a positive movement towards a greener future. This policy was implemented in schools both in New Zealand and Italy, due to an outcry by the younger demographic to be taught more about the climate crisis. We should follow suit, as a leading country in this fight.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590815

The national curriculum already requires schools to teach students about potential effects of, and mitigation of, increased levels of carbon dioxide and methane on the Earth’s climate: https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/840002/Secondary_national_curriculum_corrected_PDF.pdf

attributes.action: House builders should include solar panels in all new property developments.
attributes.background: The Government should pass laws which require all new house-builds to be fitted with solar panels. The cost of this should not be borne by the tax payer but by the construction companies.
attributes.additional_details: Renewable energy is an absolute necessity in the fight against climate change. House building companies make substantial profits, some of which should be used to make their developments more environmentally sustainable. If the government is serious about climate change they should create this legislation to support it.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action:

Make it compulsory for all new buildings to have solar panels
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/584316

attributes.action: Grant Amnesty to overstayers willing to work in Health & Social Care
attributes.background:
Stop deportation of overstayers and retrain them to work in health and social care. 

Grant amnesty to help recruitment in Healthcare and Social Care 
There are plenty of people already in the country with no papers or delays from home office.
This will help staffing in the industry
attributes.additional_details:
Health and Social Care  is currently experiencing severe staffing shortages more so now due to Covid Fatigue.
We need a large workforce to sustain demand in care homes, hospitals etc

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see changes to policy regarding people who overstay their visa conditions, but it's not clear exactly how you want this to work. Your petition says that Government should "Stop deportation of overstayers and retrain them to work in health and social care", but we couldn't accept a petition calling for overstayers to be forced to train and work in health and social care.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to create a scheme for people who have overstayed to apply to work in health and social care, instead of being removed from the country.

attributes.action: Make all cars in the UK electric because its better for our environment.
attributes.background: I would like the Government or Parliament to make all cars in the UK electric because its better for the environment and it will help our planet be a  better place.If we don't do it, our planet wont be a better place it will be a worse place for us and all the animals on the Earth to live on.
attributes.additional_details: If they don't do it and all the cars don't become electric pollution could take over the world.This is bad bad because people with asthma could get worse and people could get lung cancer.Electric cars would be better because it is more sustainable and they don't produce pollution or CO2.If we don't use electric cars more often by 2050 global warming doesn't stop it could take over the world because it very very bad for us and all of the animals.Animals could loose their homes if nothing happens.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We're not sure if you want the Government to ban everyone from using non-electric cars, or if you'd like the Government to work to turn all cars into electric cars, and how quickly you'd like this to happen. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Give pensioners the equivalent in payment as illegal immigrants in benefits/aid.
attributes.background: Put pension payments up by a realistic amount that reflects the minimum wage and the cost of benefits given to sustain an illegal immigrant or refugee.
attributes.additional_details: Pensioners have worked years contributing directly by income tax, national insurance and indirect taxation. But the payment is far below the minimum wage. They have contributed only to exist on a pittance to see immigrants being freely given what they were told would be used to provide a comprehensive and comfortable pension. Yet the immigrant has not contributed one penny, reports say they cost far in excess of a pensioners allowance. Give pensioners a reasonable life not just an existence

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  Illegal immigrants are not entitled to benefits, but we're not sure that you want pensioners to also not be entitled to any benefits. 

You can read more here:

https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/sn05621/

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, such as calling for an increase in the state pension to be equal to the minimum wage for a full working week, if that's what you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Move Bangladesh to amber list from red list
attributes.background: Move Bangladesh from red list to amber list.
attributes.additional_details: Many Bangladeshi citizens work and reside in UK and often have to travel for important family issues during this pandemic. Provided that red list means mandatory hotel quarantine and comes with a cost is a lot to bear for us who has to provide for family back home and sustain family here in UK as well.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/582789

attributes.action: Urgently increase retention of experienced general medical practitioners (GPs).
attributes.background: Urgently revise government strategy to substantially increase GP/patient ratio, introduce effective measures to protect GP mental health, increase GP retention rates & ensure fulltime equivalent GP numbers increase substantially & sustainably to meet current & future demands placed on primary care.
attributes.additional_details: GP retention rates are incapable of meeting current & future patient demand. This country has less than 1 GP per 2000 patients; comparable countries have 7 GPs per 2000 patients. Greatly increased pressures on GPs & rapidly worsening GP/patient ratios should be addressed urgently. Without well-resourced GPs, the burden increases on A&E units, minor surgery & hospital outpatient clinics, and the mental & physical health of the population suffers, with consequent damage to the economy and society.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about numbers and retention of GPs, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Ensure that everyone can get an appointment with their GP within five days: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/587428

attributes.action: Nullify Nuclear Weapons budget to sustainably support crucial International Aid
attributes.background: The government should refrain from depleting international aid, which respects around to 4 billion reductions annually. To support both British citizens after the pandemic impact on their lives but also international aid, the 8 billions that are spent annually on nuclear weapons need to be blocked.
attributes.additional_details: Under the guise of boosting the UK economy, the government has decided to cut down billions of funding that would help poorer countries to get access to basic hygiene utilities, such as clean water.  Instead, the government should nullify the excessive money that is spent on nuclear weapons production. In that way, the funds can be appropriately allocated to sustain citizens at the national level, but also keep on providing impactful aid towards countries that struggle to maintain basic needs

rejection.details:
We can't verify your claim that the UK spends £8 billion a year on its nuclear deterrent, but we have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Do not reduce the overseas aid budget (from 0.7% GDP): https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/561068

Dispose of the UK's Nuclear Warheads and encourage other nations to do the same: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574779

attributes.action: Introduce the 50+1 rule to UK Sport
attributes.background: Introduce the 50+1 rule to UK sport, giving supporters the majority voting rights to ensure that clubs are run for the benefit of fans and the community.
attributes.additional_details: It would protect the largest spectator sport in the world for it's most important stakeholder. It would also encourage sustainability and put an end to damaging bankruptcies seen lower down the football pyramid.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action:

'Enforce the “50+1” Rule for professional football club ownership in the UK': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/583310.

You might like to know that on Monday 19 April the Culture Secretary Oliver Dowden MP said that he was appalled by the announcement that a handful of clubs are proposing to form their own breakaway European league, ands said the Government would not hesitate to protect one of our greatest national institutions: football. The Culture Secretary said that the Government would back the football authorities to stop this move, and if the football authorities couldn’t act, the Government would. The Culture Secretary said the Government would "put everything on the table to prevent this from happening."

You can read the Culture Secretary's full statement on the European Super League here: https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/statement-by-oliver-dowden-on-the-european-super-league

Since you started your petition it has also been announced that all six Premier League teams that were initially involved in the European Super League have withdrawn. You can read a report of this news here: https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/56823501

Further, on 19 April the Government announced a 'Fan-led review of football governance', which will explore ways of improving the governance, ownership and financial sustainability of clubs in English football, building on the strengths of the football pyramid. You can read more about this review here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/fan-led-review-of-football-governance

attributes.action: Drastically reduce the production and distribution of advertising flyers
attributes.background: Every day thousands of advertising flyers are produced by large companies and posted through the doors of UK homes. The vast majority of these are unwanted and immediately recycled or binned. Please introduce legislation limiting who can legally mass create and distribute flyers.
attributes.additional_details: This practice is a terrible waste of energy and resources. Despite having significant advertising budgets some larger companies continually distribute mass flyers. There are more sustainable methods of advertisment available and organisations should be encouraged to behave in a more responsible manner in this regard.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the production and distribution of flyers, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. It's not clear who you want to be banned from producing and distributing flyers, and who you want to be allowed to continue to do this, or if there are any other restrictions you want to be imposed.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Make it law that shops must turn lights off when closed
attributes.background: Create a law to make it illegal for shops to light their windows during closed hours.  To work alongside legislation to help stop climate change.
attributes.additional_details: Energy being used to light shop windows when stores are closed is a massive waste. This is adding greatly to climate change. The money saved by companies should be being used to protect jobs and source more sustainable products and production technologies.  There is no evidence that stores are at more risk of burglaries due to no store lighting.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Require shops to have their lights switched off after closing
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550430

attributes.action: Ban water sold in single use plastic bottles.
attributes.background: I’m asking the government to prevent the sale of water in single use plastic bottles to reduce the rate of plastic consumption in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Bottled water is pointless and dangerous. It's suffocating marine animals, leaching micro plastics into our water supplies and contains chemicals that harm human health. 
Plastic is not sustainable. Its main component is alkenes obtained from oil, and it can't be recycled indefinitely. 
Plastic is polluting the environment, it’s bad for human health and it’s not sustainable. We have got to stop being so dependent on it and must remove unnecessary plastic items.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Ban the use of non recyclable plastics in food/drink packaging
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551778

Ban single use plastics and the unnecessary use of plastic packaging
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552450

Introduce a levy on single-use disposable plastic
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554035

attributes.action: Replace bottled water with water fountains in the UK
attributes.background: Single use water bottles need to be replaced. Fountains could be filled with water supplied by bottled water companies. Customers could be charged to fill up their own reusable water bottles with water from these fountains.
attributes.additional_details:
Bottled water is pointless and dangerous. It's suffocating marine animals, leaching micro plastics into our water supplies and contains chemicals that harm human health.
Plastic is not sustainable. Its main component is alkenes obtained from  oil, and it can't be recycled indefinitely. 
Plastic is polluting the environment, it’s bad for human health and it’s not sustainable. We have got to stop being so dependent on it and must remove unnecessary plastic items.

rejection.details:
It is up to individual businesses whether to sell bottled water or establish commercial water filling stations.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Make drinking water facilities mandatory in service stations and town centres: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334268

We could also accept a petition calling for the Government to ban water being sold in single-use plastic bottles, if that's something you want to happen.

attributes.action: Drop GDP as the primary measure of success, adopt Inclusive Wealth instead
attributes.background: Gross Domestic Product has long been the primary yardstick for measuring the welfare of the nation - but it fails to acknowledge the role of nature in supporting the economy. Changing to Inclusive Wealth instead will allow government to re-frame goals, and legislate to encourage sustainable business
attributes.additional_details: The imminent collapse of so many eco-systems globally are an existential threat to civilisation. The Dasgupta Review into the Economics of Biodiversity offers a realistic roadmap of change to avoid this calamity - but requires Government to lead and encourage business into fundamental changes in economic planning, and use of natural resources. The review is explicit - without change we are facing a global crisis.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want the Government to change its priorities, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

GDP is one measures if and how much the economy is growing, but it does not have any formal status as the primary measure for success.

You could start a new petition calling for the Government to produce a strategy to increase inclusive wealth, or encourage sustainable business, if that's what you want to happen, but it would need to be clear what actions you want the Government to take.

attributes.action: Rebate the difference to persons affected by the ethnic and gender pay gap.
attributes.background: I would like the goverment to rebate the ethnic minorities and females the difference for those who have had a work history in proffesional services who were in receipt of unequal pay due to ethnic and gender pay gap.Our pay affects NI contributions which inturn affects our pension.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the goverment to do this. As for generations ethic and female employees of large organisations have been paid substantially less and offered the lowest roles.Our pay ulitmatley affects our state pension and its unethical that ethic and female persons will receive less at pensionable age regardless of having a sustained work history.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We're not sure whether you want the Government to be responsible for paying any pay differences as a result of discrimination by employers, or if you'd like all women and ethnic minorities to receive a grant. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
